intro: Cynoglossum oschense, commonly known as the blueweed or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and may have a slightly aromatic scent, while the flowers are clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. Cynoglossum oschense is a perennial herb that is native to Europe but has been naturalized in parts of North America.
